text: the great thing about the surrealist
stuff is that you don't have to think
about migrating a big app or building
out this huge application you just have
to think about one task you know one
unit of work right just put that in a
function deploy it set it and forget it
you know and kind of walk away and
that's usually kind of what happens so
that single developer brings into the
organization they deploy something right
- some little DevOps tasks cron job that
runs reliably for the first time you
know and and then they get some you know
then their friends come over and they
say like either colleagues ok that's
pretty cool you know you made that let's
put some more stuff in a few functions
right and then soon they have about 10
20 functions going and then some some
directors some decision maker looks at
that and says hey let's build out a full
application they start moving into
usually the rest API so microservices
kind of internal micro services is a big
use case and that captures a lot of
attention
fast forward to some organizations that
use lambda and use our tools a couple
years later they have thousands of
functions thousands and they're using
that for everything they're doing a
customer facing API is you know a big
data processing pipelines and doing
lambda edge they're doing step functions
workflows and that's one of the cool
things to me
